unnormalised: New Delhi: Students across India are prepping for their upcoming Maths exams, and a recent discovery in geometry has everyone buzzing! A team of researchers at IIT Kanpur has reportedly found a simpler way to calculate the area of irregular polygons.
normalised: New Delhi: Students across India are prepping for their upcoming Maths exams, and a recent discovery in geometry has everyone buzzing! A team of researchers at I-I-T Kanpur has reportedly found a simpler way to calculate the area of irregular polygons.

unnormalised: Instead of the conventional, lengthy formulas, they've developed a new algorithm that's said to reduce the calculation time by almost 40%! Imagine the relief for those struggling with complex problems involving shapes with, say, more than 7 sides. This could be a game-changer for competitive exams like the JEE!
